page.title: 18NAIRN:FARMERS FIELD
page.content: Fairly close to the centre of the town is a large area of open space which is grassed over.It is owned by the local farmers and annually is the site for the{agricultural show}which is a small version of the type to be found throughout Britain. The field is in constant use during the summer for many other events such as{vintage car rallies, sheepdog {trials, }and fetes. It has an all year use as a traing ground for sports such as football. It is only within the last generation that the field has found itself in a central position since the housing to the south and west is postwar. Without it Nairn would appear far less open to its detriment. Other areas of open space occur around large houses such as Newton (a hotel) and Viewfield (council offices)
